column3: Not sure this is needed, but ACK on the code change.\n
I still dislike the parameter description.\n
@Diapolo what do you suggest for the parameter description? I changed it to that as per @luke-jr's suggestion.\n

I think the parameter name should somehow match the description, so I propose `Shrink debug.log file on client startup (default: 1 when no -debug)`, which uses a similar wording like -discover in the brackets. If you don't like that just keep it, I guess there are more important problems to discuss ;).\n

How about this?

``` C++
if (GetBoolArg("-shrinkdebugfile", !fDebug))
```

Don't forget docs:

``` C++
"  -shrinkdebugfile       " + _("Keep debug.log file small (default: opposite of -debug)") + "
" +
```
That would certainly make it closer to the previous behavior Happy to change this unless anyone objects.\n
I'm not sure if that is a nice string and understandable by users ...\n
Perhaps `Keep debug.log file size below 10MB (default: opposite of -debug)`.\nI just think "small" is too general.\n
I think 10MB is too specific. Perhaps instead of a flag on whether to shrink or not, perhaps a flag on what size to shrink at (with zero meaning never shrink)?\n

So more like -maxdebuglogsize, which can be set to 0 (not limited) or or to a certain value that sets the limit, when reached, debug.log gets shrunken. I like this idea, if you would keep a default value > 0.\n
